intro: Biscutella laevigata subsp. atropurpurea, commonly known as purpleleaf biscuitroot, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes many flowering plants with small, cross-shaped flowers. The plant features basal leaves that are lanceolate and often have a purple or reddish hue, contributing to its ornamental value. It produces yellow flowers in early spring, followed by small, capsule-like fruits. This subspecies is adapted to rocky and well-drained soils, often found in open woodland and mountainous regions.
